abstract: Mr. Kuehler guided the company while it dominated the world’s computing landscape in the 1980s.
snippet: Mr. Kuehler guided the company while it dominated the world’s computing landscape in the 1980s.
lead_paragraph: Jack D. Kuehler, an electrical engineer who became the highest ranking technologist at I.B.M. and guided strategy as president and later vice chairman while the company dominated the world’s computing landscape in the 1980s, died on Dec. 20 in Rancho Santa Fe, Calif. He was 76.

headline.main: Jack D. Kuehler, Former I.B.M. President, Dies at 76
headline.print_headline: Jack D. Kuehler, 76, Guiding Force at I.B.M.
